result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1st Page Only
Revoked - Sentenced to County Jail/HOC
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Richard Bender
Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Amanda L Higgins in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:16 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
100 days jail
3 days credit.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
First half must be in jail, second half on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by jail administration.
STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by DOC. 

Count 2 - 
100 days jail
Concurrent with Count 1.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
First half must be in jail, second half on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by jail administration.
STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Engage in any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by DOC.

Defendant Amanda L Higgins in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:13 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, requests the warrant to be quashed and for the Court to conduct an initial appearance.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.

Defendant has received a copy of the complaint and has reviewed it.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Court advises Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Defendant called the public defender's office and states that they said she makes too much money.
Defendant cannot hire her own lawyer.

Court advises Defendant regarding a request for indigency.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, if Defendant can file for court appointed counsel, matter could be set for a ptc and indigency hearing at the same time.

Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court enter pleas of NOT GUILTY on behalf of Defendant.

State addresses bond.

Address of Defendant is verified.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:45 am.
